meta_description: An art museum and cultural center in Los Angeles known for its artist-centric and progressive array of exhibitions and public programs. Affiliated with UCLA (University of California, Los Angeles).
hours_text:
Hours & Directions

  * [Hours & Directions](/visit)
  * [Know Before You Go](/know-before-you-go)
  * [Accessibility](/visit/accessibility)
  * [Family Visits](/visit/family-visits)
  * [Tours](/visit/tours)

#  Hours & Directions

## Admission

Admission to the Hammer is free, and advance reservations are not necessary. Groups of 10 or more should [register as a self-guided tour](https://hammer.ucla.edu/visit/tours).

_Free Admission at the Hammer Museum is courtesy of Marcy Carsey, the Erika J Glazer Family Foundation, and the Anthony Pritzker Family Foundation._

## Hours

**Monday:** Closed  
**Tuesday–Thursday:** 11 AM–6 PM  
**Friday:** 11 AM–8 PM  
**Saturday–Sunday:** 11 AM–6 PM  

See [Lulu's hours and learn about lunch and dinner reservations](https://hammer.ucla.edu/restaurant).

The museum is always closed Mondays, July 4, Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day.

Museum hours are subject to change.

## MEMBERS

When arriving at the museum, find the member line for immediate entry. For a streamlined visit, use your digital membership card. If you need a new digital card or would like an updated version, please contact the membership department at 310-443-7050 or [membership@hammer.ucla.edu](mail to: membership@hammer.ucla.edu).

## Directions

The Hammer is located at the corner of Westwood and Wilshire boulevards in Westwood Village, three blocks east of the 405 freeway's Wilshire exit.

Hammer Museum  
  
10899 Wilshire Boulevard  
  
Los Angeles, CA 90024 ...

collections_text:
# Hammer Museum

Stay in the know with emails from the Hammer.

[Sign Up](https://hammer.ucla.edu/sign-up-for-email-from-the-hammer)

The Hammer Museum at UCLA believes in the promise of art and ideas to illuminate our lives and build a more just world.

### [Five Centuries of Works on Paper: The Grunwald Center at 70

  * Dec 20, 2025 – May 17, 2026

This exhibition marks the 70th anniversary of the Grunwald Center, celebrating its history through a selection of significant works that reflect the collection’s breadth and diversity.  ](/exhibitions/2025/five-centuries-works-paper-grunwald-center-70)

### [Made in L.A. 2025

  * Oct 5, 2025 – Mar 1, 2026

The seventh iteration of the Hammer’s biennial exhibition highlighting the practices of artists working throughout the greater Los Angeles area.  ](/exhibitions/2025/made-la-2025)

### [Armand Hammer Collection This impressive collection of European and American paintings and drawings reflects the interests and passion of the museum’s founder, Armand Hammer.  ](/collections/armand-hammer-collection)

### [Alake Shilling: Buggy Bear Crashes Made in L.A.

  * Oct 5, 2025 – Mar 1, 2026

Shilling’s monumental inflatable depicts one of her signature characters—a stern-eyed bear in a hot-pink convertible—atop a colossal strawberry-studded shaped hilltop with daisies.  ](/exhibitions/2025/alake-shilling-buggy-bear-crashes-made-la)
